title: Synthetic Recap
body:
**Raptors Outlast Wolves as Stoudamire Erupts for Franchise-Record 54**

TORONTO (AP) – In a season of building blocks, the Toronto Raptors constructed a monument Wednesday night. Powered by an electrifying, franchise-record 54 points from point guard Damon Stoudamire, the Raptors outgunned the Minnesota Timberwolves, 113-107.

This was not merely a victory; it was a historic coronation for "Mighty Mouse." Stoudamire was simply unguardable, putting on a shooting clinic that left the Wolves defense scrambling from the opening tip. He poured in his points with ruthless efficiency, connecting on eight three-pointers and getting to the line at will, all while dishing out eight assists in a masterful floor game.

Minnesota, led by Kevin Garnett's 26 points and 14 rebounds, refused to wilt. The teams traded blows throughout a frantic second half, with the Wolves' physicality inside nearly tipping the scales. But every time Minnesota mounted a charge, Stoudamire had an answer—a silky pull-up jumper, a dagger three from well beyond the arc, or a perfectly timed dish to a teammate.

His final points, a pair of clutch free throws in the waning seconds, iced the game and sealed his place in the Raptors' record book. The 54 points shattered his own franchise record, a performance that announced both his individual brilliance and the rising potential of Toronto's young franchise.

On a night where defense was optional, one man’s offensive explosion was all that mattered. The Raptors didn't just win a game; they witnessed history, authored by the mighty heart of their smallest star.
